job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Miami, FL
pros: The culture here is great. People arenice to work with. Job is easier because you have a lot of good resources- plenty of care assistants to help, supplies are readily available and easily accessible, computers are in all rooms and alcoves of the icu towers. I really love working here.
cons: Only downside is the pay isn’t as high as other places but its worth it to take a little off the pay to like where you work.

review_title: Amazing team to work for, amazing company, overall an incredible place to be.
job_title: Clinical Systems Analyst in Miami, FL
pros:
Flexible remote schedule
Strong internal management that advocates for his or her team
The company has done an incredible job keeping us informed as well as engaged within the company so that we continue to have that family feel as a whole
Room and encouragement for growth
cons:
Still working out some of the challenges of remote work (i.e. the most efficient way to show productivity, how to organize projects, etc)
Currently a bit understaffed due to the pandemic, and while we are recovering, we still have a lot of work on our plate. Management does a great job in helping us maintain this though

review_title: Stay away from the Research Institute
job_title: Senior Clinical Research Coordinator in Miami, FL
pros: The hospital itself is GREAT, but the Research Institute is small, toxic, and borderline unethical.
cons: High turnover; management is horrendous; supervisors show little-to-no appreciation. VERY TOXIC environment where creativity and growing as a professional are strongly discouraged so much so that eventually your spirits break and you give up.

pros: Employees are cared for. Great benefits

pros: Benefits are ok, although not great. Free parking which you usually would not find larger academic hospitals. Pay is fair if you are able to negotiate and advocate for yourself. Nice to serve such a diverse community.
cons: There are individuals at director and manager roles that really should not be. Poor communication and leadership skills seemed common. The really talented people I knew seemed to not stay long-term, often going to other health systems in the community for better salaries and opportunity.

review_title: Every hospital has pros and cons!
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Amazing nursing management, great staffing ratios most days, teaching hospital, non-judgment zone, no required on-call shifts, no required overtime, all children's hospital
cons: High turnover in critical care (you'll see this everywhere, though), high acuity patients make it harder for safe staffing, but they try. Teaching hospital means a lot of hands in the pot, not the best pay, but also not the worst. I would stay here over going back to my previous position any day. My happiness and sanity were much higher and much healthier here! The pros definitely outweigh the cons.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Miami, FL
pros: Great team of professional peers to work alongside, pediatrics is the best
cons: Poor pay, staffing ratio issues, poor employee retention efforts, lack of policy enforcement unless when convenient

pros:

They are only interested in checking off the list of pointless items on their list. They are driving out the rest of the good employees in that department.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Miami, FL

review_title: Not the best place to work lately
pros: Telecommuting is now full time and work/life balance is good for some in IT
cons: Lack of Pension and 403 match, reduced benefits

pros: It a hospital great place to get experience
cons: Adjusting schedule, over all no complains

review_title: Great strategy if you are a robot
pros: The employees who work at MCH are very dedicated and compassionate. Most used to enjoy working for MCH and if things changed, would still love working there.
cons:
Most of the senior leadership team acts like robots & treat their employees like robots. Instead of promoting employees using positive and engaging behaviors, they demotivate employees & try to control everything employees do.  No one ever does a good enough job and we all are rated the same--unless you want to play politics, "always say the 'right' thing" and do the ALMOST impossible for an organization you have NO heart left for.  It's a culture of micromanagement--everyone is busy doing a bunch of nothing. Most of the senior team is in the wrong fit; the "Chief Talent Officer" has NO idea how to engage or create talent...he embodies nothing regarding talent or care for employees. 
The COO has no idea how to connect with people and thinks that's they way business is run--and the new CFO has no clue who works for him. Most in the C-suite think they have the answers as they try and outsmart you or their peers.  The house is burning down and everyone is pretending it's fine.

pros: Great people and positive environment
cons: Salary is not competitive for the area

review_title: Respected organization with high standards, morals and integrity?????
pros: I truly believe most MCH employees love working at the hospital. Doctors, Nurses and staff all take a great deal of pride delivering outstanding care to all the children that come to the hospital 7x24x365.
cons: Some members of executive management team lack integrity and morals which is very sad for such a once proud organization.  The new leadership team does not lead by example and DO NOT adhere to  MCH Way core principals championed by CEO / Dr. Kini. Case in point: A certain SVP that will remain nameless has lost the trust of  some senior executives including their own staff because they all have witnessed first hand how they manage and treat employees by bullying, intimidation and manipulating.

review_title: Great Place To Work, Poor Senior Team
pros: Known to families and visitors as a caring hospital. Disney like. Informal at the front end level. People smile. Welcoming environment. Nice kid touch everywhere you go. Very nice play room and family center.
cons: Recognition is non-existant. Email recognition. People are promoted if they know how to play the game. Fake it and you are good to go. Too much politics. Forget about speaking up. CEO is a wonderful salesman with poor management skills. Leading by consequence and fear. Not enough focus on real engagement strategies. The people side is completely ignored. It's all about process. Strategy looks good on paper but the amount of work is not manageable. No room for creative minds. Senior management plays "Simon says" and you better jump non stop.

review_title: I feel like I wasted my time (and money)
pros: Nothing was great about this company. No pros here unless you think that working a dead-end job is your career path. The company tries to promote a culture friendly workplace, but it is all a lie. Their motto is "Anything is possible" and "For health, for life." None of their values really align with these sayings. "Work until you can work no more" should be their motto; with no chance of promotion, raise or even simple recognition.
cons: Everything: including low pay and hostile work environment (by upper management). I even paid for the employee parties out of my own pockets and I never got reimbursed for any of them. Cheapest company I ever worked for, with no respect for their low waged, overworked employees. I have worked for many horrible bosses before, but this was the worst one. Also, I have seen terminations of employees that are unjustified.

pros:
Job satisfaction knowing we are helping children and their families.
Good work/life balance.  Opportunity for growth.  Great benefits.
cons: Pay may not be compatible with other area health care organizations.  In the last few years there has been a reduction in employee morale.  More work load given to employees and departments do not seem adequately staffed.  With all of that said it seems there has been an increase in number of higher management positions lately which looks badly to the employees we are asking to be conscience of budget to.

review_title: A great place to work in Miami!
pros: MCH has great health benefits at a reasonable cost, tuition reimbursement, annual success sharing bonuses, and staff that are passionate about their job.  This has been one of the best places I have ever been employed at. Yes, it's hard work and long days sometimes, but it's worth it. We have flex work hours, and seem to have more and more employees working remote, which is a fantastic morale booster. I think most of our leaders are good, and some are wonderful. I love the clowns and pets, who not only make the children and families laugh and smile, but the staff as well!
cons: There are no food options or discounts for offsite employees.

review_title: We do it all for the kids!
pros: Great place to work. Whether you directly deal with patients or not, you still feel like you make an impact in the lives of the children and families we serve. The atmosphere is really family like and you can look forward to seeing smiling faces every day. Clinicians provide great quality work. Support teams provide excellent support to help clinicians do their exceptional work. Benefits are some of the best I've seen out there! For example, I just gave birth a few months ago and my entire bill pre and post pregnancy was $200. Great onsite amenities like dry cleaning service, credit union, pharmacy and more. I can't say enough, MCH really provides so much for its employees.
cons: All levels of leadership needs to be more present and engaged. It should be lead by example so they more than anyone should exemplify the MCH Way.

review_title: Not the best but definitely not the worst.
job_title: Behavioral Health Tech in Miami, FL
pros: As a full time employee in the psych department I was given a decent benefits package. Insurance, 401k, and PTO that you could basically use when you want. In the psych department, scheduling was kinda easy. I went to school and they accommodated my schedule spot on. They also had tuition reimbursement upto 4k as long as you're full time. The hospital, It's normally clean (as hospitals go), they have loads of activities for the kids, and the nurses seem to enjoy their jobs. Nice discount on food :)
cons: As usual the management isn't perfect. It's a lot of people to answer to but no real progress or issues solved. Parking isn't great and the pay for a full time behavioral health tech started at $10.20 for me with my bachelors and no experience.

pros: New technology, new services provided.  Best patient care for pediatric patients. Excellent physicians.
cons: Too many leaders, not enough staff to meet the demands of the leaders. Strategies/ initiatives look great in paper but leaders do not work together to put these strategies/initiatives in place. Organizational silos. Departments do not work together. Leaders want to be the HERO when they come across a deficiency in another department. Reactive not proactive. Inadequate business tools to gather accurate financial and statistical information.

review_title: Great Hospital with amazing benefits and focus on customer service
pros: MCH is a place that has a unique blend of long-tenured employees who represent the essence of its founding vision and new staff with a lot a cutting-edge ideas and processes. There is a lot of innovation, research and focus on Lean Methodologies. All of this is carried out through an internal culture and guiding principles, the MCH Way. The members of the MCH Family have a legacy of caring for children and are committed to their roles in this renowned institution.  It is a world-class hospital with eight outpatient centers that is nationally and internationally regarded. This community is lucky to have a hospital of this caliber that has evolved into a healthcare system for children.
cons: There is a lot of competition in South Florida in the field of pediatrics. This creates challenges for a freestanding children's hospital.

review_title: Best Company I ever worked for.  Great Benefits, wonderful collaboration and support system, "can do" environment.
pros: MCH culture has been a true differentiator. No other institution offers these values and understanding. Great nursing leadership.  TME support and vision has been extraordinary. Digitization and improvements over the past few years have been second to none.  Quality care and great achievements, recognized in US News Report. Great marketing team, receiving top awards; recognized nationwide.
cons: Too many initiatives, often pulled in too many directions. Not adequate resources (capital or staff) to support all new initiatives.  At times unrealistic expectations.

review_title: IT Leadership is non-existent-Not a good place for an IT Professional to work
pros: Flexible Schedule, Health Insurance is a bit more expensive than last year due to system cost cutting, but still better than most places. 403b still has a 100% match up to the first 3% of contributions.
cons: Absence of leadership; No Collaboration; Absence of strategy and goals. Employees are treated like lemmings. Directors and Management never communicates anything and likes to pretend they are the experts in it all. They take all the credit and give no recognition. Benefits are being cut. They cut the 3% annual contribution to the retirement package and reduced total bank of PTO hours from 400 to 300. No room for professional development. IT is a dead end.

review_title: MCH way traning has a looong way to go
job_title: Tray Service Worker in Miami, FL
pros:
You get full time benefits as a part time employee.
Their current MCH Way plan to make everyone friendlier an helpfull is wonderful.
Easy to move around the ladder and to transfer to a diferent possition
Did I mention the excelent benefits?
cons:
Horrible management. Their scheduling is ridiculous. Constantly changing, even days before.
The new management is afraid of reprimanding the more senior employees which have yet show any sign of adapting the new "friendlier" business plan.
You get to see a very ugly side of the hospital, which is not necesarily friendy, ethical, or child friendly

review_title: Terribly Political. It used to be good prior to 2009 when new VPs came in.
job_title: Non-Patient Care Manager in Miami, FL
pros:
As a hospital, patient care staff is top notch. 
Benefits are ok
Good Colleagues
cons:
There is simply NO OVERSIGHT by the board. They're being given cooked numbers. 
VPs have their own agendas and openly stab each other in the back (alarmingly political)
Board of Directors (the non-employees) seem either unaware of what's going on and buy into any status reports without doing ANY audits. 
Too many directors without qualifications or experience are promoted. 
There are NO STANDARDS outside patient care. 
HR is terrible. They allow management to penalize without following HR protocols.

job_title: Registrar in Palm Beach Gardens, FL
pros: MCH has been a rewarding place to work for. MCH provides excellent work-life balance. Training is always available, just ask management and they will help you achieve the training you need. The benefits MCH provides to their employees are unmessurable! It has been a blessing to be part of MCH. I have been employeed with MCH for almost 2 years now and I look forward to many more.
cons: Some of the challenges at MCH are promotions. You need to really sell yourself off to management and constantly go the extra mile to be considered for a promotion.

pros: Good place to work if you just follow the rules, keep to yourself, and stay quiet. The hospital is trying very hard to be a good place to work.
cons: Some departments and their managers do not care about their employees.  The hospital is short staffed and the employees are overworked. There is a LOT of incompetence to go around.

pros: Patients were always treated with respect.
cons: Unprofessional management/supervisors; I was obtaining my bachelors degree and my manager had only received a high school diploma. Pay needs to be better especially for employees with degrees.Discouraging and at times a hostile work environment. Favoritism and employees who would arrive on-time and were responsible were taken for granted (part of the reason why I left).

pros: Department management is very supporting and encouraging.  Salaries and benefits are competitive.    Leadership is making obvious efforts to improve quality and consistency.
cons: In some areas, Managers and Directors come and go with alarming speed.  It's very difficult to build good working relationships because of this.  There are very tall silos and it is often difficult to gain consensus and get a project started.  This is also a very political environment.  Almost from day one I've received warnings about who is connected to who and what hot buttons to stay away from if I want to succeed here.

pros:
Staff continues to show they care about children
MCH Culture of 2007 has not been completely killed
Directors are survivors even if they are running like chickens
Some employees and leaders still lead by example
cons:
Ambulatory Services senior leadership is reactive 24/7 leads by fear, everything is a priority 365 days
Talent senior leadership leads with a 1960's perspective and does not hold accountable a certain senior leader VP in technology even  though there are many proofs of intimidation
There is no employee engagement, this is an all time low level
No recognition program and no strategy for it

pros: Some people here help you feel welcomed & are always willing to give you a hand.
cons: Some personalities throughout the hospital are not very people friendly.  Acknowledging & being friendly goes a long way.

pros: You meet great people. New employees are eager to be the best they can be. Health insurance, retirement plan, and other benefits almost make it worth while to work there.
cons:
Senior Leadership should all be replaced. They have forgotten what it is like to work for a living. They depend on the work that those underneath them produce. Work ethics? None. Honesty? Very few. True leadership skills? Rare. 
They encourage you to speak your mind but if you do, beware.

review_title: Amazing organization with a true commitment to its employees.
pros: The opportunities for personal growth and development that have been afforded to me have been wonderful. I have been supported by my leaders as well as leaders throughout the organization and have seen progressive expansion of my responsibilities and duties.
cons: As a small organization, the top of the pyramid is relatively narrow. There is only so much ascension before you become limited in vertical growth. Also, unless you are a member of a professional organization, the think tank becomes shallow in regards to outside perspective.

review_title: A great company with inferior management.
pros: A great company with excellent benefits. The education department is the best I have ever had the pleasure to work with.
cons: No accountability for managers and directors from upper management. If you are lucky to work in a department with good management it is an excellent place to work. Unfortunately this is rarely the case at this once great institution.

review_title: Good environment to work but lack of clear directions in some areas.
pros:
There is a very comfortable environment to work, tools provided are appropriated to get the job done.
Very good life work balance.
cons: There is a lack of clear leadership in some areas, in some cases too much time is wasted just trying to figure out what is what the managers want.

review_title: Leadership is lacking fundamentals of what the Hopital stands for.
pros: The staff is always dedicated and love there work
cons: The MCH Way and leadership does the talk but not the walk. It seems that employees who have dedicated themselves to the cause are treated with no respect and tossed out when a new leader comes in.  It's all about who you know and not what you know.

job_title: Clinical Systems Analyst in Miami, FL
pros: All of the management - directors, managers, team leads, etc. - are available at all times as well as supportive at all times. They create a team environment that helps you truly believe in the product and your work. Teams are flexible and growth is achieveable.
cons: Turnover in upper management has recently been high.

review_title: Best hospital to work for in South Florida
pros: There is NEVER a dull moment @ MCH! If you enjoy a busy environment and the work that goes along with high expectations, this is a GREAT place work.
cons: Leaders in the Organization are not always open to hearing about and addressing the real challenges of day to day operations.

review_title: Good place and a good opportunity.
pros:
- Best place to learn a lot about to technology. 
- People are the best to work with.
- Management strive to show caring for employees.
cons:
- Aggressive turnover. 
- Stressful at times, not always.
- Many deadlines which employee looses focus.

pros: The Mission, Vision, and Values tied to the patient population; the organization and specifically the physicians try their best to be very patient oriented.
cons: The management of the organization struggle with organization, execution, and most importantly have a flawed culture and even worse a lack of transparency.

review_title: Good clinical care.  Leadership a mixed bag of Mary Poppins idealism and outright incompetence
pros: Caring for Kids!  Majority of staff dedicated. Mission statement and vision laudable.
cons: Execution of vision and  financial responsibility disastrous with coverups and  shifting  of blame to middle management by incompetent and often self-serving leadership.

review_title: An ok job if you are not looking for upward mobility
pros: Great culture and values, ok benefits.
cons: Benefits could be much better, I disagree with Health benefits forcing you to regular checkups or your premium goes up. Management is obsessed about lean processes by rushing every product out the door.

review_title: Good experience but no room for professional & lack of Spanish major reason.
pros: Worked in a great department with no leadership.
cons: Manager was unprofessional when dealing with staff. He hated any type of confrontation & pushed staff to deal with issues that needed his mediation.  What could have been a close department was divided. The director was hands off.

job_title: Medical Support Assistant in Miami, FL
pros: Great health benefits, tuition reimbursement, 401k, they have a daycare for employees which is very convenient for employees. Pay isn't that great though
cons: workers are overwhelmed with the amount of work there because every department is understaffed. You only have a chance to get a promotion is you know the right people.

pros: exposure to as many different aspects of the hospital's administration if you prove yourself. Good place to get your feet wet.
cons: Generally the attitude of co workers is very catty and they will back stab you any chance they get. It's like being in middle school with 30-40 year olds. Management ignores the issue even when confronted.

review_title: Great mission with a Toxic Culture
pros: Pay and benefits, great mission and endorsement from the Nicklaus !
cons: Where to begin, a place with such a great mission but with a very toxic culture. No accountability and preferential treatment by a group of loyalist to the CEO. There is no vision, alignment or transparency. The word is out in the community about this place. The SILOS are the norm here and ignored by all.   If you are planning to work here think again and don’t waste your talent.

pros: Meet a lot of people of love it, great place to learn and develop.
cons: Not many areas to move up to, you get stuck in the same position and only get promoted if you "Know" someone.

job_title: Director of Facilities in Miami, FL
pros: This is a very rewarding place. Has a I care attitude for staff and patients.
cons: Needs more funding from community or organizations. They are helping some of the most ill children and need more financial support.

review_title: Positive work environment but challenges with senior leadership
pros: Collegial work environment where the staff is passionate about serving the patients and families
cons: The organization is slow to make decisions and execute, making it rather inflexible and behind the curve

job_title: Senior Service Coordinator in Miami, FL
pros: Great training department and development opportunities paid by the company for your benefit!
cons: Jobs are not equitable for women and hospital outreach centers are still not aligned to main hospital goals.

review_title: Your just a number - no employee loyalty
pros: great employee compensation benefit package
cons: I was very impressed at first but was disappointed to see that upper management is always going through some sort of restructure process leading to lay-off's instead of changing the executive leadership culture

pros: MCH is an excellent place to work at. Good benefits and very foucs  on training and developing leaders.Love my job and the people I work with.
cons: Changes are great for an institution ;however ,too many changes at one time can create a culture of insecurity .

review_title: Was a good experience to my work in MCH and appreciate the opportunity to work there.
job_title: Medical Records Clerk in Weston, FL
